title: Reaserchers' Night Project 2016-2017 in Israel
objective:
Following previous TEN years of successful implementation of European Researchers' Night in Israel we will have:
o Venues covering the whole country.
o Involvement of the academic community including Israel Ministry of Science, Technology and Space (MOST), all major research
universities, leading collages and three science museums.
o Awareness campaign at national level managed and funded by the Israel Ministry of Science, Technology and Space.
o Groups of junior-high and high-school students (ages 12-18) will be invited by each partner to take part in each venue.
We are ready and proud to implement European Researchers' Night 2016 & 2017.
誰 All of the partners involved in the project have the experience of running successful European Researchers' Nights events.
誰 With the successive increase in number of visitors along the years and the reputation of the event we are expecting more than
55,000 visitors each year.
誰 Same management as in 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015 successful events.
誰 Proposal covers both 2016 & 2017 European Researchers' Night events.
coordinator: ISRAEL NATIONAL MUSEUM OF SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND SPACE DANIEL AND MATILDE RECANATI CENTER
participants: UNIVERSITY OF HAIFA;WEIZMANN INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE;Bloomfield Science Museum Jerusalem (BSMJ);ISRAEL OCEANOGRAPHIC AND LIMNOLOGICAL RESEARCH LIMITED;BAR ILAN UNIVERSITY;TEL AVIV UNIVERSITY;AL-QASEMI ACADEMY ASSOCIATION;THE OPEN UNIVERSITY*;THE HEBREW UNIVERSITY OF JERUSALEM;SAMI SHAMOON COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING(R.A.) FRIENDLY SOCIETY;MIGAL GALILEE RESEARCH INSTITUTE LTD;INTERDISCIPLINARY CENTER (IDC) HERZLIYA;ORANIM ACADEMIC COLLEGE OF EDUCATION - THE KIBBUTZ MOVEMENT
